title: DIANNmv
text: package can used process analyze mass spec data generated DIANN. mainly uses DEP package hood, can use DEP functions created summarizedExperiment object (check DEP vignette). Also included visualization function prefer default DEP options.

title: DIANNmv
text: report.pg_matrix, report.pr_matrix expDesign combined summarizedExperiment (se) object used downstream analysis plotting. create se object, can run prepare_se() function report.pg_matrix file associated experimental design. can specify type imputation done. default ‘knn’, better DIA data think. DDA data, ‘MinProb’ good. ‘none’ entered impute parameter, imputation done. Additionally, can filter missing values (missing_thr), potential contaminants removed default. (Source: contaminants.txt file maxquant).  provide report.pr_matrix alongside report.pg_matrix, peptide information automatically added can filter minimal number razor/unique peptides (min_pep, default = 0). Make sure sample column names identical match label column experimental design.  summarizedExperiment object stores lot information. can see output , consists 5584 proteinGroups (rows) 9 samples (columns). Furthermore, experimental design stored ‘colData’, extra information stored ‘rowData’. log2 transformed intensities form main assay. Furthermore, report.pr_matrix file provided, second assay added. detailed description structure summarizedExperiments, check documentation. short, access different parts data:
code: se <- prepare_se(report.pg_matrix, expDesign) # without peptide information #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning in knnimp(x, k, maxmiss = rowmax, maxp = maxp): 36 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; #>  mean imputation used for these rows #> Cluster size 5548 broken into 2022 3526  #> Cluster size 2022 broken into 673 1349  #> Done cluster 673  #> Done cluster 1349  #> Done cluster 2022  #> Cluster size 3526 broken into 1495 2031  #> Done cluster 1495  #> Cluster size 2031 broken into 1030 1001  #> Done cluster 1030  #> Done cluster 1001  #> Done cluster 2031  #> Done cluster 3526 se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 5584 9  #> metadata(0): #> assays(1): '' #> rownames(5584): A2M A2ML1 ... ZYX ZZZ3 #> rowData names(9): Protein.Group Protein.Names ... imputed num_NAs #> colnames(9): neg_ctrl_1 neg_ctrl_2 ... motif2_2 motif2_3 #> colData names(4): label ID condition replicate # Add peptide information and remove all proteinGroups with <2 total  # razor/unique peptides se <- prepare_se(report.pg_matrix, expDesign, report.pr_matrix, min_pep = 1) #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning in knnimp(x, k, maxmiss = rowmax, maxp = maxp): 19 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; #>  mean imputation used for these rows #> Cluster size 5237 broken into 2152 3085  #> Cluster size 2152 broken into 1645 507  #> Cluster size 1645 broken into 656 989  #> Done cluster 656  #> Done cluster 989  #> Done cluster 1645  #> Done cluster 507  #> Done cluster 2152  #> Cluster size 3085 broken into 1977 1108  #> Cluster size 1977 broken into 976 1001  #> Done cluster 976  #> Done cluster 1001  #> Done cluster 1977  #> Done cluster 1108  #> Done cluster 3085 se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 5256 9  #> metadata(0): #> assays(2): '' peptide_info #> rownames(5256): A2M A2ML1 ... title: DIANNmv
text: information automatically added se object running prepare_se() providing report.pr_matrix file (see ). can also manually add report.pg_matrix() file following code. get number razor/unique peptides per proteinGroup per sample total number razor/unique peptides samples, add report.pg_matrix file: adds new columns suffix ‘npep’ report.pg_matrix number identified peptides per sample, ‘n_total’ total number identified razor/unique peptides per proteinGroup.
code: peptides <- get_nPep_prMatrix(report.pr_matrix) pg_matrix <- add_peptide_numbers(report.pg_matrix, peptides) colnames(pg_matrix) #>  [1] "Protein.Group"             "Protein.Names"             #>  [3] "Genes"                     "First.Protein.Description" #>  [5] "neg_ctrl_1"                "neg_ctrl_2"                #>  [7] "neg_ctrl_3"                "motif1_1"                  #>  [9] "motif1_2"                  "motif1_3"                  #> [11] "motif2_1"                  "motif2_2"                  #> [13] "motif2_3"                  "neg_ctrl_1_npep"           #> [15] "neg_ctrl_2_npep"           "neg_ctrl_3_npep"           #> [17] "motif1_1_npep"             "motif1_2_npep"             #> [19] "motif1_3_npep"             "motif2_1_npep"             #> [21] "motif2_2_npep"             "motif2_3_npep"             #> [23] "n_total"

title: DIANNmv
text: iBAQ values can added pg_matrix file well. , need number theoretically observable peptides, non-normalized intensities. number iBAQ peptides reviewed human mouse uniprot entries included package can accessed : want use , can create similar object fasta file: Non-normalized intensities can calculated sum individual peptide intensites report.pr_matrix file: combined add_iBAQ() function, addes columns iBAQ values column number iBAQ peptides report.pg_matrix. use included iBAQ peptides, specify organism. use custom file, specify ‘ibaq_stats’ parameter. iBAQ values automatically added summarizedExperiment object running prepare_se() function. addition, number iBAQ peptides added rowData.

title: DIANNmv
text: perform differential protein expression analysis, run get_DEPresults() function. three main types: ‘manual’ (1 vs 1), ‘control’ (vs 1), ‘’ (vs ). ‘manual’, can also specify contrasts want test providing character vector ‘tests’ parameter.addition, can choose p.adj cutoff log2 fold change cutoffs significant, method FDR correction. DEP default ‘fdrtool’, given weird results past. Therefore, default ‘BH’ (Benjamini-Hochberg), also default limma uses (DEP uses background). get_DEPresults returns data frame statistics specified tests, can used visualization afterwards.
code: # To test a 1 vs 1 comparison res_man <- get_DEPresults(se, condition1 = 'motif1', condition2 = 'neg_ctrl',                       type = 'manual') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl  # To test multiple 1 vs 1 comparisons res_man2 <- get_DEPresults(se,                            tests = c('motif1_vs_neg_ctrl', 'motif1_vs_motif2'),                            type = 'manual') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl, motif1_vs_motif2  # To test all conditions vs 1 reference condition res_ref <- get_DEPresults(se, ref_condition = 'neg_ctrl', type = 'control') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl, motif2_vs_neg_ctrl  # To test all vs all res <- get_DEPresults(se, type = 'all') #> Tested contrasts: neg_ctrl_vs_motif1, neg_ctrl_vs_motif2, motif1_vs_motif2

title: DIANNmv
text: plotVolcano() function returns volcano plots specified significance cutoffs. 1 comparison present results data frame, list volcano plots returned can accessed ‘$’ operator. Check help page plotVolcano() (?plotVolcano) see different options labeling specific points volcano.
code: plotVolcano(res_man) # Default volcano plot if one comparison is present. # labels all significant points (can be a bit much).   volcano_list <- plotVolcano(res_ref, label = '') # returns list of volcano plots                                                  # Don't label anything. volcano_list$motif1_vs_neg_ctrl # Select which plot you want to see. # Example of a very ugly volcano plot. plotVolcano(res_man, pval_cutoff = 0.001, fc_cutoff = 2,             up_color =  'blue', down_color = 'yellow', ns_color = 'green',             label = c('SMAD3', 'SMAD4'))

title: DIANNmv
text: median_peptide_intensities added se, can also plot MA-plot, abundances x-axis, fold-changes y-axis. Significant hits indicated blue/red:
code: plot_MA(res_man, label = c('SMAD3', 'SMAD4')) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text_repel()`).

title: DIANNmv
text: can also make Venn diagram showing overlapping significant proteins. default, comparisons present results data frame used, can handle five comparisons maximally. can specify comparisons include.

title: DIANNmv
text: alternative Venn diagrams, can also plot protein membership upset plot. Individual components plot can altered plot made. Check ‘ggupset’ vignette instructions .  Finally, get overview number identified significant proteins per condition:  can change conditions included, order columns, labels:
code: upset_plot <- plot_upset(res) upset_plot plot_DEP_barplot(res) # Include only two comparisons and change the order: plot_DEP_barplot(res, comparisons = c('neg_ctrl_vs_motif2',                                       'neg_ctrl_vs_motif1')) # Same as above, but axis labels are changed. plot_DEP_barplot(res, comparisons = c('neg_ctrl_vs_motif2',                                       'neg_ctrl_vs_motif1'),                  names = c('motif2', 'motif1'))

title: DIANNmv
text: GSEA can performed results get_DEPresults(). works results object contains one comparison. make lot sense GSEA DNA pull , used demonstration purposes nonetheless. addition results object, need gene sets want test. , need download msigdb superset gene sets, extract sets want. commonly, cancer hallmarks (h), curated gene sets (c2) gene ontology gene sets (c5) used. extract : perform GSEA, use results object gene sets choice:
code: db <- load_msigdb(organism = 'hs') # loads the super set #> see ?msigdb and browseVignettes('msigdb') for documentation #> downloading 1 resources #> retrieving 1 resource #> loading from cache #> require("GSEABase") #>  #> Warning in getMsigOrganism(gsc, idType): Assuming the organism to be human.  # retrieve the cancer hallmarks  geneset_hallmarks <- get_genesets(db, collection = 'h')   # retrieve the GO:biological process gene sets. # similarly molecular function (GOMF) and cellular compartment (GOCC) can be  # retrieved geneset_gobp <- get_genesets(db, collection = 'c5', subcollection = 'GOBP') res <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif1', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl gsea <- perform_GSEA(res, geneset_gobp) #> Warning in preparePathwaysAndStats(pathways, stats, minSize, maxSize, gseaParam, : There are ties in the preranked stats (0.04% of the list). #> The order of those tied genes will be arbitrary, which may produce unexpected results.

title: DIANNmv
text: several options visualize GSEA results. simplest bar plot, showing just Normalized Enrichment Scores (NES). default options shows significant results. specifying top_n parameter, can include n pathways lowest padj value.   plot_gsea_dotplot() function, can include information pathways:  third way way visualize results GSEA volcano plot NES x-axis -log10(padj) y-axis. Like volcano plot DEP visualization, can specify label points.   ran multiple GSEAs different results objects (get_DEPresults()), can plot single bubble plot.
code: # Bar plot of 10 pathways with lowest padj values. barplot <- plot_gsea_barplot(gsea, top_n = 10) barplot #Bar plot of 10 pathways with lowest values and different colors for bars. barplot2 <- plot_gsea_barplot(gsea, pos_color = 'red3',                                neg_color = 'dodgerblue', top_n = 10)  barplot2 dotplot <- plot_gsea_dotplot(gsea, top_n = 10)  dotplot # Plot all significant points (can be chatoic) volcano <- plot_gsea_volcano(gsea)  volcano # plot 10 significant points with the lowest padj value on both sides of volcano. volcano <- plot_gsea_volcano(gsea, top_n = 10)  volcano res1 <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif1', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl res2 <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif2', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif2_vs_neg_ctrl  gsea1 <- perform_GSEA(res1, geneset_gobp) #> Warning in preparePathwaysAndStats(pathways, stats, minSize, maxSize, gseaParam, : There are ties in the preranked stats (0.04% of the list). #> The order of those tied genes will be arbitrary, which may produce unexpected results. gsea2 <- perform_GSEA(res2, geneset_gobp) #> Warning in preparePathwaysAndStats(pathways, stats, minSize, maxSize, gseaParam, : There are ties in the preranked stats (0.02% of the list). #> The order of those tied genes will be arbitrary, which may produce unexpected results.  bubble <- plot_gsea_bubbleplot(gsea1, gsea2,                                sample_names = c('motif1', 'motif2'), top_n = 10)  bubble #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).
